member.name: M:CodeTitans.JSon.IJSonWriterObjectItem.WriteMember(System.String)
member.summary: Writes a member only to an object. It requires to be called before writing an object (or array) inside current object. Writing values after call to this function is also allowed, however it is not recommended due to number of checks performed. The better performance can be achieved if other overloaded functions are used.

member.name: T:CodeTitans.JSon.JSonReader
member.summary: Reader class capable of parsing texts and providing them as JSON objects (or arrays of objects).

member.name: T:CodeTitans.JSon.IJSonReader
member.summary: Interface defining all read operation that might convert a JSON string into its tree representation that could be traversed.

member.name: M:CodeTitans.JSon.IJSonReader.Read(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Converts a JSON string from given input into a tree of .NET arrays, dictionaries, strings and decimals.

member.name: M:CodeTitans.JSon.IJSonReader.Read(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a JSON string from given input into a tree of .NET arrays, dictionaries, strings and decimals.

member.name: M:CodeTitans.JSon.IJSonReader.ReadAsJSonObject(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Converts a JSON string from given input into a tree of JSON-specific objects. It then allows easier deserialization for objects implementing interface as those objects exposes more functionality then the standard .NET ones.

member.name: M:CodeTitans.JSon.IJSonReader.ReadAsJSonObject(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a JSON string from given input into a tree of JSON-specific objects. It then allows easier deserialization for objects implementing interface as those objects exposes more functionality then the standard .NET ones.

member.summary: Value of JSON 'null' keyword string.

member.summary: Value of JSON 'true' keyword string.

member.summary: Value of JSON 'false' keyword string.

member.summary: Init constructor.

member.summary: Returns reader to the original state.

member.summary: Reads next token from the input source.

member.name: M:CodeTitans.JSon.JSonReader.ReadNextToken(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads next token from the input source with a possibility to treat already known character as the one read. Option required mostly for JSON elements that don't have a closing tokens (i.e.: ']' for arrays) and used for number and keywords.

member.name: M:CodeTitans.JSon.JSonReader.ReadAsJSonObject(System.IO.TextReader)
member.summary: Converts a JSON string from given input into a tree of JSON-specific objects. It then allows easier deserialization for objects implementing IJSonReadable interface as those objects exposes more functionality then the standard .NET ones.

member.summary: Converts a JSON string from given input into a tree of JSON-specific objects. It then allows easier deserialization for objects implementing IJSonReadable interface as those objects exposes more functionality then the standard .NET ones.
